Crowell et al.
75 extracted the monoterpenoid d-limonene ( 58), one of the end products of the metabolism of mevalonate in plant cells, which is widely found in orange peel and some plant essential oils. Compound 58 is one of the few natural anti-tumour products known to have both chemopreventive and chemotherapeutic effects. Besides, d-limonene is also a very effective chemotherapeutic agent, which can cause 80% complete regression of rat breast cancer induced by chemical factors
76–78 . Currently, d-limonene has entered phase I clinical studies in the UK
79 .
